avalancheActivity.comment: A hiker triggered a small avalanche in Esjan, W-facing slope at around 400 m a.s.l. A small avalanche released in Reykjafell in Mosfellsbær on Jan 6th. Avalanches released on the evening of Jan 5th, over Grafningsvegur by Þingvallavatn, in Svínahlíð. An avalanche released in Þrengslin, probably in the first days of the year.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rising temperatures and rain could cause some avalanches. Unstable wind slabs and facets have formed in the mountains. People could trigger avalanches on steep slopes and in gullies where snow has accumulated. A few avalanches have released in the area.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It has snowed in variable directions which has likely formed unstable wind slabs in isolated spots in the mountains, especially on SE-NW aspects. High temperature gradient in the snowpack may have caused weaknesses to form in the snow pack. Rising temperatures on Friday and Saturday which could cause some avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend is likely to cause avalanche activity in most parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend may cause avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: S-A-lægar áttir næstu daga. Hlýnar á föstudag og þykknar upp, dálítil úrkoma á föstudag og laugardag. Aðfaranótt sunnudags gengur í suðaustan hvassviðri með talsverðri rigningu. Búast má við miklum leysingum en styttir svo upp seinnipart sunnudags. Á mánudag er aftur gert ráð fyrir rigningu og hlýindum

avalancheActivity.comment: A thin but wide slab avalanche fell in Breiðadalur, likely in the first days of the year. No reports of avalanches in northern Westfjords since December 30th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in various aspects and, some places, a weak layer with facets underneath. Slow warming is expected on Friday, and on Saturday warm temperatures with rain up to mountain tops. This can trigger natural avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered rather thin wind slabs are in various aspects. Some places, there is a persistent weak layer underneath, formed in a cold spell. Snow pits and informal observations suggest that the structure and stability of the snowpack can vary a lot within small areas. Weak layers with faceted crystals have been found in some spots, with stable snow right next to them. Few slopes are expected to have a continuous weak layer across large areas, and weaknesses more likely in areas where the snowpack is shallow. Avalanches could release due to warm weather this weekend, first dry avalanches and then wet as the thaw has more effect.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend is likely to cause avalanche activity in most parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend may cause avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar smám saman á föstudag með sunnan éljagangi, svo rigningu eða slyddu um kvöldið. Fremur hlýttá  laugardag með rigningu á köflum. Alhvöss SA átt fyrripart sunndags, rigning og hlýindi, en dregur úr um hádegisbil. Á mánudag er gert ráð fyrir rigningu um tíma og suðlægum áttum.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are present in various aspects, with weak layers of faceted crystals in some areas underneath. A gradual warming is forecast for Friday, followed by warmer temperatures and rain reaching the mountain tops on Saturday. These conditions could trigger natural avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thin, layered wind slabs are present in the mountains across various aspects. Persistent weakness formed during the prolonged cold period. Snow pits and informal observations indicate that the structure and stability of the snowpack can be highly variable. In some areas, weak layers with faceted crystals have been found, while stable snow is observed right nearby. Weak layers are more likely in places where the snowpack is shallow with a steeper temperature gradient. Avalanches could occur due to the warming expected over the weekend, with dry avalanches likely early and wet avalanches later on as warming progresses.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend is likely to cause avalanche activity in most parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend may cause avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar smám saman á laugardag og úrkomulítið. Smám saman hlýnar upp í fjallatoppa aðfaranótt sunnudags og rignir á sunnudagsmorgun til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two avalanches released in Bjólfur on january 7th and one small avalanche above Neskaupstaður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are found in gullies and may be unstable in places. Avalanches are likely durnig warm weather this weekend and rain on Sunday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Recent snow lies on top of a crust and is mostly confined to gullies and depressions. Wind slabs have formed on southerly aspects in gullies. Weak layers may have developed during cold spell. With warming weather and rain this weekend, wet avalanches are likely.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend is likely to cause avalanche activity in most parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are in the mountains in most parts of the country but avalanche danger is generally not high, although small slabs may be unstable. Warming over the weekend may cause avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar smám saman á laugardag og úrkomulítið. Smám saman hlýnar upp í fjallatoppa aðfaranótt sunnudags og rignir á sunnudagsmorgun til fjalla.
